text: Located within the premise of the Enabling Village, this grocery store is designed with PWDs in mind. Wider aisles  and more accessible lower shelves are great for the wheelchair bound. The store is also equipped to help anyone in need with call buttons at the entrance and near the shelves. Special shopping basket that can be lifted mechanically at the checkout lane is also a very help feature.

A simple NTUC where you can get your daily needs. Choices are not that great but it is good enough to serve the nearby residents.

The staff are familiar with the elderly residents need and know their regular purchase. Sometimes they will point out and ask if they make accidental purchase... quite impress, saw it a few times!!!
Suitable for person with disabilities. Tall shopping basket with wheels.

Limited stuff and stock of items. It's more of a training store for those with special needs and new staff. Nevertheless the staff are friendly and helpful.  In addition, behind the store you able to get gongcha bubble tea run by professor brawn associates...
A small NTUC but has most of what we need daily. Staffs are friendly and place is always very clean. Grocery shopping there is rather comfortable.
